subject: Re: [junit] Hidden fields in Http-Unit
msgSnippet: On Fri, 25 Apr 2003 11:06:32 +0530, Ranjeet Sahay  ... One - try the HTTP-Unit mailing list.  You may find some answers here since many
messageBody:
On Fri, 25 Apr 2003 11:06:32 +0530, "Ranjeet Sahay" <rsahay@...>
said:
> This message only has an HTML part -- this is a text generated
> representation
>
>
> Hi,
> I have been using JUnit and Http-Unit for Testing portals and all is
> going well when i find that Http-Unit has limitations.
> First is JavaScript where even the FAQ doesnot have much info about
> how
> to use for various events. I guess any good portal would be incomplete
> without JavaScript and Http-Unit should have more examples and APIs to
> handle JavaScript in a webpage.
> Secondly, handling of "hidden field" in a form. While testing, it is
> never allow to change the value of a hidden field. Why is this so if
> it
> is a parameter in the form.
> Any solutions?

One -> try the HTTP-Unit mailing list. You may find some answers here
since many JUnit-ers use HTTP-Unit, but then again you may not.

--
=jason
[:question | ^One]
